segments.text: Good afternoon , Mrs.Vale . Please sit down .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Thank you .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Did you work as a salesperson before , Mrs.Vale ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Only as a clerk in a store .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . Well , consulting is a little different .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm a quick learner , Mr.Jenkins .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Umm hmm . Do you have a diver's license ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , and I'm a very good driver .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Fine . We provide a company car for our consultants .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do I have to travel a lot ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh yes-five days a week . You have to visit customers all over the territory .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But how will I get to know the products ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You'll have to attend a three-week course . If you do well , the job is yours .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How much is the salary ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Starting salary is $ 150 a week-plus commissions , of course .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How much commission do your consultants get ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Five percent .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I'm very interested in the job .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Fine . The next course starts a week from tomorrow .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Thank you .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Good luck to you .
segments.speaker: S1
